trial_identification.studytitle: Effectiveness of calf muscle stretching for plantar fasciitis: a randomised trial
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effectiveness of calf muscle stretching for the reduction of symptoms of plantar fasciitis: a randomised trial

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other inflammatory or immune system disorders

interventions.interventions: Intervention group: Calf muscle stretches using wooden wedge (five minutes daily for two weeks) and placebo ultrasound (one initial session).
interventions.comparator: Placebo group: placebo ultrasound only (one initial session).

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at baseline and follow-up (two weeks later).

primaryOutcome.outcome: 2) Foot Health Status Questionnaire - foot pain, foot function, general foot health.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Plantar fasciitis symptoms (localised pain at heel; worse on first rising; reduces with initial activity; pain increases with increasing activity); symptoms present for four weeks or more; able to complete outcomes; informed consent.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Orthopaedic, metabolic or endocrine disorders that may affect the plantar fascia; cortisone injection in past three months.

trial_design.concealment: Sealed opaque envelopes. Before opening participant details were written on envelope and video taped. Aluminium foil inside envelope to render envelope impermeable to intense light.
